intro: Metrosideros rotundifolia, commonly known as the Christmas bush, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to eastern Australia and is characterized by its small, round, glossy leaves and clusters of bright red, pink, or orange flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various garden conditions. The flowers attract birds and insects, contributing to its ecological importance in native habitats.
